intro: Boechera pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered rockcress, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. This plant is characterized by its basal leaves that are often divided into narrow lobes and small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in alpine or arctic environments. Boechera pauciflora is also noted for its ability to produce a large number of seeds, which aids in its propagation and survival in harsh climates.
